WorkItem.Description:
This issue can be easily reproduced. DataGrid columns seem to "run away" out of the grid  and the VisualStudio hangs if the DataGrid is in the scope of a non-named Style containing the Margin Property for Buttons.
This problem was reported here, but unfortunately I can't find the thread.
 
To see this effect do the following: 
1. create a new WPF-solution 
2. add а WPFToolkit.dll reference 
3. place a DataGrid in the window 
4. add an unbound DataGridTextColumn (or of any other type, I suppose) 
5. add a style for the Button TargetType and set the Margin Property value to 1 
 
Here is the corresponding XAML: 
 
<Window x:Class="WpfApplication1.Window1"
    xmlns="http://schemas.microsoft.com/winfx/2006/xaml/presentation"
    xmlns:x="http://schemas.microsoft.com/winfx/2006/xaml"
    Title="Window1" Height="300" Width="300" 
    xmlns:my="http://schemas.microsoft.com/wpf/2008/toolkit">
 
    <Window.Resources>
        <Style TargetType="{x:Type Button} ">
             <!-- uncomment the next line to  reproduce the problem -->
            <!-- <Setter Property="Margin" Value="1"/>-->
        </Style>
    </Window.Resources>
 
    <Grid>
        <my:DataGrid Name="dataGrid1" AutoGenerateColumns="False">
            <my:DataGrid.Columns>
                <my:DataGridTextColumn Header="DataGridTextColumn" />
            </my:DataGrid.Columns>
        </my:DataGrid>
    </Grid>
</Window>
 
You still can use Margins in Button-Styles, if you give them a name
WorkItem.Summary: DataGrid columns running away. A workaround to a known problem.

Comments.Message:
This is expected behavior.  In the upper-left corner of the DataGrid, there's a blank button which, when you click it, selects all of the cells in the datagrid.  When you use an implicit style for Button, as in the example above, the margin gets applied to that button, which is what is causing the columns to run away.  As you mentioned, the solution is to name your style to make it explicit instead of implicit, which will prevent the Select All button from being affected by the style.

Thanks!
Samantha
